entry.title: GitHub Actions: Granular personal access token scopes for self-hosted runners in enterprises
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Granular personal access token scopes for self-hosted runners in enterprises

entry.title: Improved notification email titles for issues and PRs
entry.summary: Improved notification email titles for issues and PRs

entry.title: Set via API whether a repository allows forking
entry.summary: Set via API whether a repository allows forking

entry.title: Easier to search branches by exact name
entry.summary: Easier to search branches by exact name

entry.title: All repositories are labeled public, private, or internal
entry.summary: All repositories are labeled public, private, or internal

entry.title: Winter-swimming Scandinavian men can teach us how the body adapts to extreme heat and cold
entry.summary: The Scandinavian winter swimming culture combines brief dips in cold water with hot sauna sessions -- and now, a study of young men who participate regularly in these polar plunges finds that winter swimming may allow the body to adapt to extreme temperatures. The findings suggest that routinely alternating swims or dips in chilly water with sauna sessions might affect how brown fat, also known as brown adipose tissue (BAT), burns energy and produces heat.

entry.title: Precision medicine data dive shows diuretic pill may be viable to test as Alzheimer's treatment
entry.summary: A commonly available, FDA-approved oral diuretic pill may be a potential candidate for an Alzheimer's disease treatment for those who are at genetic risk, according to new findings.

entry.title: Researchers find warning signs for dementia in the blood
entry.summary: Researchers have identified molecules in the blood that can indicate impending dementia. Their findings are based on human studies and laboratory experiments. The biomarker is based on measuring levels of so-called microRNAs. According to the study data, microRNAs could potentially also be targets for dementia therapy.

entry.title: Sleep loss does not impact ability to assess emotional information
entry.summary: It's no secret that going without sleep can affect people's mood, but a new study shows it does not interfere with their ability to evaluate emotional situations. It is often assumed that feeling more negative will color people's experience of emotional images and events in the environment around them. However, researchers found that while going 24 hours without sleep impacted study participants' mood, it did not change their performance on tests evaluating their ability to process emotional words and images.

entry.title: Public preview: Dynamic concurrency in Azure Functions
entry.summary: Azure Functions dynamic concurrency feature simplifies configuring concurrency for your function apps.

entry.title: Alzheimer's and COVID-19 share a genetic risk factor, study finds
entry.summary: An anti-viral gene that impacts the risk of both Alzheimer's disease and severe COVID-19 has been identified by researchers.

entry.title: Checkout.com and FullStory are now GitHub secret scanning partners
entry.summary: Checkout.com and FullStory are now GitHub secret scanning partners

entry.title: npm CLI upgraded to version 8
entry.summary: npm CLI upgraded to version 8

entry.title: ‘Gut bugs’ can drive prostate cancer growth and treatment resistance
entry.summary: Common gut bacteria can become 'hormone factories' - fuelling prostate cancer and making it resistant to treatment, a new study shows. Scientists revealed how gut bacteria contribute to the progression of advanced prostate cancers and their resistance to hormone therapy -- by providing an alternative source of growth-promoting androgens, or male hormones. The findings, once further validated in the clinic, could provide new opportunities for the treatment of prostate cancer through manipulation of the microbiome.

entry.title: A 'cousin' of Viagra reduces obesity by stimulating cells to burn fat
entry.summary: Researchers have found that a drug first developed to treat Alzheimer's disease, schizophrenia and sickle cell disease reduces obesity and fatty liver in mice and improves their heart function -- without changes in food intake or daily activity.

entry.title: A 'cousin' of Viagra reduces obesity by stimulating cells to burn fat
entry.summary: Researchers have found that a drug first developed to treat Alzheimer's disease, schizophrenia and sickle cell disease reduces obesity and fatty liver in mice and improves their heart function -- without changes in food intake or daily activity.

entry.title: Clean air matters for a healthy brain
entry.summary: Researchers say their studies on air pollution and cognitive decline -- one involving humans and one with mice -- provide evidence that cleaner air may reduce risk for Alzheimer's and other dementias.

entry.title: Beyond childhood: Picky eating in college students
entry.summary: Looking beyond the picky eating of childhood, researchers looked at this behavior in college students. Self-identified picky eaters ate significantly less fiber and vegetables and reported greater levels of social phobia than non-picky eaters, according to a new study. Social phobia is the fear of being evaluated during everyday activities by others.

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Workflows triggered by Dependabot PRs will respect permissions key in workflows
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Workflows triggered by Dependabot PRs will respect permissions key in workflows

entry.title: Azure Functions Python 3.9 support is now generally available
entry.summary: Python developers can now take advantage of the version enhancements in Python 3.9 using Azure Functions.

entry.title: Toxic fatty acids to blame for brain cell death after injury
entry.summary: Cells that normally nourish healthy brain cells called neurons release toxic fatty acids after neurons are damaged, a new study in rodents shows. This phenomenon is likely the driving factor behind most, if not all, diseases that affect brain function, as well as the natural breakdown of brain cells seen in aging, researchers say.

entry.title: Export Organization Members
entry.summary: Export Organization Members

entry.title: Deprecation Notice: Codes of Conduct API preview
entry.summary: Deprecation Notice: Codes of Conduct API preview

entry.title: Dependency review is generally available
entry.summary: Dependency review is generally available

entry.title: Color-coded nutrition labels and warnings linked to more healthful purchases
entry.summary: A new analysis has integrated findings from 134 studies of the impact of color-coded nutrition labels and warnings found on the front of some food packaging, indicating that these labels do indeed appear to encourage more healthful purchases.

entry.title: The npm registry requires TLS 1.2 or higher
entry.summary: The npm registry requires TLS 1.2 or higher

entry.title: Cancer chemotherapy drug reverses Alzheimer’s symptoms in mice
entry.summary: A drug commonly used to treat cancer can restore memory and cognitive function in mice that display symptoms of Alzheimer's disease, new research has found. The drug, Axitinib, inhibits growth of new blood vessels in the brain -- a feature shared by both cancer tumors and Alzheimer's disease. This hallmark represents a new target for Alzheimer's therapies. Mice that underwent the therapy not only exhibited a reduction in blood vessels and other Alzheimer's markers in their brains, they also performed remarkably well in tests designed to measure learning and memory.

entry.title: GitHub Actions: DRY your GitHub Actions configuration by reusing workflows
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: DRY your GitHub Actions configuration by reusing workflows

entry.title: A Redesigned Explore tab on GitHub Mobile
entry.summary: A Redesigned Explore tab on GitHub Mobile

entry.title: Ketone supplement might be a novel therapeutic for boosting brain function in obesity
entry.summary: New research has shown that ketone supplements may be a novel therapeutic strategy for protecting and improving brain health in people with obesity.

entry.title: Research shows exercise-related proteins can suppress tumor growth
entry.summary: New research shows bed and rest might not be the best treatment for people suffering from cancer -- in fact, the opposite may be true. Researchers have discovered the proteins created by the body when exercising - called myokines -- can suppress tumor growth and even help actively fight cancerous cells.

entry.title: Research shows exercise-related proteins can suppress tumor growth
entry.summary: New research shows bed and rest might not be the best treatment for people suffering from cancer -- in fact, the opposite may be true. Researchers have discovered the proteins created by the body when exercising - called myokines -- can suppress tumor growth and even help actively fight cancerous cells.

entry.title: Natural compound in basil may protect against Alzheimer’s disease pathology
entry.summary: Fenchol, a natural compound abundant in some plants including basil, can help protect the brain against Alzheimer's disease pathology, a preclinical study suggests. The team discovered a sensing mechanism associated with the gut microbiome that explains how fenchol reduces neurotoxicity in the Alzheimer's brain.

entry.title: Improvements to GitHub Releases – public beta
entry.summary: Improvements to GitHub Releases - public beta

entry.title: Brain-circuit discovery may help explain sex differences in binge drinking
entry.summary: A brain circuit that works as a 'brake' on binge alcohol drinking may help explain male-female differences invulnerability to alcohol use disorders, according to a preclinical study.

entry.title: Button to toggle Markdown rendering
entry.summary: Button to toggle Markdown rendering

entry.title: The npm advisory database is now part of the GitHub Advisory Database
entry.summary: The npm advisory database is now part of the GitHub Advisory Database

entry.title: The push webhook payload provides a consistent head_commit on tag creation
entry.summary: The push webhook payload provides a consistent head_commit on tag creation

entry.title: Age and aging have critical effects on the gut microbiome
entry.summary: Researchers have found that aging produces significant changes in the microbiome of the human small intestine distinct from those caused by medications or illness burden.

entry.title: What you need to know about urinary tract infections
entry.summary: More than half of U.S. women will experience at least one urinary tract infection (UTI) in their lifetimes, while a quarter will have a subsequent infection. Recurrent urinary tract infections are defined as two or more infections in six months or three or more in a year.

entry.title: Scientists discover 14 genes that cause obesity
entry.summary: The discovery of genes that directly cause obesity could pave the way for treatments for a condition that affects more than 40% of American adults.

entry.title: Aerobic exercise after a sport-related concussion speeds recovery in adolescent athletes, study suggests
entry.summary: Adolescents can speed their recovery after a sport-related concussion and reduce their risk of experiencing protracted recovery if they engage in aerobic exercise within 10 days of getting injured, according to a new study.

entry.title: Early accumulation of tau in the brain predicts memory decline in Alzheimer’s disease
entry.summary: Researchers have compared how well different Alzheimer's biomarkers predict the progression of the disease and its effect on the memory. They found that early accumulation of tau proteins in the brain as measured by PET scanner was more effective at predicting memory impairment than biomarkers in the cerebrospinal fluid or amyloid plaque in the brain.

entry.title: Deprecation Notice: Recover Accounts Elsewhere
entry.summary: Deprecation Notice: Recover Accounts Elsewhere

entry.title: More effective treatment of Alzheimer’s
entry.summary: Researchers have designed new antibodies that might provide more effective treatment methods for Alzheimer's disease. By designing antibodies that bind even to the smaller aggregates, or clumps, of the amyloid-beta protein, it may be possible to check the progress of the disease.

entry.title: Movement of genes within cells helps organisms tell time
entry.summary: Using the relatively simple clocks found in fruit flies, researchers reveal that the subcellular location of clock proteins and genes fluctuates with the daily passage of time, indicating that spatial information is translated into time-related signals.

entry.title: GitHub Enterprise Cloud self-service organization transfers
entry.summary: GitHub Enterprise Cloud self-service organization transfers

entry.title: Enterprise managed users are now generally available
entry.summary: Enterprise managed users are now generally available

entry.title: Enabling IPv6 Support for GitHub Pages
entry.summary: Enabling IPv6 Support for GitHub Pages

entry.title: Getting beyond small talk: Study finds people enjoy deep conversations with strangers
entry.summary: People benefit from deep and meaningful conversations that help us forge connections with one another, but we often stick to small talk with strangers because we underestimate how much others are interested in our lives and wrongly believe that deeper conversations will be more awkward and less enjoyable than they actually are, according to new research.

entry.title: Footnotes now supported in Markdown fields
entry.summary: Footnotes now supported in Markdown fields

entry.title: GitHub Enterprise Cloud Services continuity plan now available for self-service
entry.summary: GitHub Enterprise Cloud Services continuity plan now available for self-service

entry.title: Study shows hormone therapy not associated with an increased risk of developing dementia
entry.summary: New research shows that the use of menopausal hormone therapy (MHT -- also known as hormone replacement therapy, HRT) is not linked to an increased risk of developing dementia.

entry.title: Colorblind themes beta
entry.summary: Colorblind themes beta

entry.title: Wiggling worms suggest link between vitamin B12 and Alzheimer's
entry.summary: Worms lose their wiggle when they get Alzheimer's disease, but researchers found that worms fed a diet of E. coli with higher levels of vitamin B12 were given a layer of protection from the dreaded degenerative brain disease.

entry.title: Wiggling worms suggest link between vitamin B12 and Alzheimer's
entry.summary: Worms lose their wiggle when they get Alzheimer's disease, but researchers found that worms fed a diet of E. coli with higher levels of vitamin B12 were given a layer of protection from the dreaded degenerative brain disease.

entry.title: The new GitHub Issues – 09/29 update
entry.summary: The new GitHub Issues - 09/29 update

entry.title: New code review assignment settings and team filtering improvements
entry.summary: New code review assignment settings and team filtering improvements

entry.title: Intermittent fasting makes fruit flies live longer — will it work for people?
entry.summary: Intermittent fasting is a trendy weight loss strategy. A new study of fasting fruit flies shows how the diet, if properly timed, also slows the aging process and increases longevity by cleaning our cells.

entry.title: Intermittent fasting makes fruit flies live longer — will it work for people?
entry.summary: Intermittent fasting is a trendy weight loss strategy. A new study of fasting fruit flies shows how the diet, if properly timed, also slows the aging process and increases longevity by cleaning our cells.

entry.title: 'Is that a bacon sandwich?' Fruit flies react to smells while asleep
entry.summary: Researchers have tracked flies' ability to interpret information while asleep, showing which parts of the brain remain 'awake'.

entry.title: E2 gene may offer some protection against cognitive decline
entry.summary: A new study shows evidence that the E2 gene is associated with a slower rate of cognitive decline with age.

entry.title: Study identifies protein important for motor coordination and exercise performance
entry.summary: Researchers have identified a protein that improves muscular metabolism, motor coordination and exercise performance in mice. The findings could be of therapeutic value for patients with muscle and neurological diseases, such as ALS.

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Jobs running on `macos-latest` are now running on macOS Big Sur (11).
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Jobs running on `macos-latest` are now running on macOS Big Sur (11).

entry.title: AI-driven dynamic face mask adapts to exercise, pollution levels
entry.summary: Researchers have developed a dynamic respirator that modulates its pore size in response to changing conditions, such as exercise or air pollution levels, allowing the wearer to breathe easier when the highest levels of filtration are not required.

entry.title: Sunset Notice Affecting Actions: API Authentication via Query Parameters
entry.summary: Sunset Notice Affecting Actions: API Authentication via Query Parameters

entry.title: How high-fat diets allow cancer cells to go unnoticed
entry.summary: The immune system relies on cell surface tags to recognize cancer cells. Researchers discovered mice who ate high-fat diets produced less of these tags on their intestinal cells, suppressing the ability of immune cells to identify and eliminate intestinal tumors. The high-fat diet also reduced the presence of certain bacteria in the mice's gut, which normally helps maintain the production of these tags.

entry.title: Small but mighty: Microgreens go from trendy vegetables to functional food
entry.summary: Starting decades ago as fashionable, high-value gourmet greens, today microgreens have gained popularity among consumers for their nutritional profile and high content of antioxidant compounds. Now, a new study suggests that the tiny plants have the potential to help provide global nutrition security.

entry.title: Reducing salt in bread without sacrificing taste
entry.summary: Most people in the U.S. consume too much salt; adult Americans typically eat twice the daily amount recommended by dietary guidelines. Bread may not seem like an obvious culprit; however, due to high consumption and relatively high salt content, baked goods are a major source of sodium in the diet. A new study from the explores ways to reduce sodium in bread without sacrificing taste and leavening ability.

entry.title: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.2 is now generally available
entry.summary: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.2 is now generally available

entry.title: Happiness in early adulthood may protect against dementia
entry.summary: While research has shown that poor cardiovascular health can damage blood flow to the brain increasing the risk for dementia, a new study indicates that poor mental health may also take its toll on cognition.

entry.title: Intense workouts before bedtime won’t guarantee a good night’s rest, new research shows
entry.summary: A new meta-analysis assessed data from 15 published studies to see how a single session of intense exercise affects young and middle-aged healthy adults in the hours prior to bedtime. And while no two bodies are the same, the researchers did find that the combination of factors would interact to enhance or modulate the effects of exercise on sleep.

entry.title: Intense workouts before bedtime won’t guarantee a good night’s rest, new research shows
entry.summary: A new meta-analysis assessed data from 15 published studies to see how a single session of intense exercise affects young and middle-aged healthy adults in the hours prior to bedtime. And while no two bodies are the same, the researchers did find that the combination of factors would interact to enhance or modulate the effects of exercise on sleep.

entry.title: Children who eat more fruit and veggies have better mental health
entry.summary: New research finds that children who eat more fruit and veg have better mental health. The study is the first to investigate the association between fruit and vegetable intakes, breakfast and lunch choices, and mental wellbeing in UK school children. The research team studied data from almost 9,000 children in 50 schools. They found that the types of breakfast and lunch eaten by both primary and secondary school pupils were significantly associated with wellbeing.

entry.title: Anti-seizure medication improves cognitive function in some Alzheimer’s patients
entry.summary: An inexpensive anti-seizure medication markedly improves learning and memory and other cognitive functions in Alzheimer's patients who have epileptic activity in their brains, according to a new study.

entry.title: Classroom’s Git Starter Course is Out of Beta
entry.summary: Classroom's Git Starter Course is Out of Beta

entry.title: Improved pull request file filtering
entry.summary: Improved pull request file filtering

entry.title: Detecting dementia in the blood
entry.summary: Researchers want to image proteins with unprecedented precision -- and thus gain insights into the molecular pathogenesis of Alzheimer's. This should pave the way for an earlier diagnosis of the dementia disorder via a simple blood test. A successful pilot study has now been completed.

entry.title: Showing code scanning alerts on pull requests
entry.summary: Showing code scanning alerts on pull requests

entry.title: Healthy changes in diet, activity improved treatment-resistant high blood pressure
entry.summary: A healthy eating plan, weight loss and improved aerobic fitness can significantly reduce blood pressure and improve heart health in people with resistant hypertension -- a condition in which blood pressure remains high despite the use of three or more antihypertensive medications.

entry.title: Healthy changes in diet, activity improved treatment-resistant high blood pressure
entry.summary: A healthy eating plan, weight loss and improved aerobic fitness can significantly reduce blood pressure and improve heart health in people with resistant hypertension -- a condition in which blood pressure remains high despite the use of three or more antihypertensive medications.

entry.title: Smartphone sensor data has potential to detect cannabis intoxication
entry.summary: A smartphone sensor, much like what is used in GPS systems, might be a way to determine whether or not someone is intoxicated after consuming marijuana, according to a new study.

entry.title: File attachment support in Markdown for gists
entry.summary: File attachment support in Markdown for gists

entry.title: GitHub Advisory Database now includes Rust advisories
entry.summary: GitHub Advisory Database now includes Rust advisories

entry.title: Child abuse and neglect linked to early death in adulthood
entry.summary: A new study found that adults who reported experiencing sexual abuse by the age of 16 had a 2.6 times higher risk of dying in middle age -- that is, between 45 and 58 -- than those who did not report sexual abuse.

entry.title: Study identifies mechanism by which nicotine withdrawal increases junk food consumption
entry.summary: New data collected by researchers demonstrate a clear connection between nicotine withdrawal and poor eating habits. Their findings point to the opioid system, the brain functions responsible for addiction and appetite regulation, as a possible cause for smoker preference of energy-dense, high-calorie food during nicotine withdrawal.

entry.title: Adjusting fatty acid intake may help with mood variability in bipolar disorders
entry.summary: Can specific dietary guidelines help people living with bipolar disorders better manage their health? Clinical trial results showed that a diet designed to alter levels of specific fatty acids consumed by participants may help patients have less variability in their mood.

entry.title: Metastatic prostate cancer comes in two forms, which could guide treatment
entry.summary: Scientists have identified two subtypes of metastatic prostate cancer that respond differently to treatment, information that could one day guide physicians in treating patients with the therapies best suited to their disease.

entry.title: npm has a new access token format
entry.summary: npm has a new access token format

entry.title: Allow Enterprise owners to toggle LFS per repository via API
entry.summary: Allow Enterprise owners to toggle LFS per repository via API

entry.title: How do migraines affect the sleep cycle?
entry.summary: Adults and children with migraines may get less quality, REM sleep time than people who don't have migraines. That's according to a meta-analysis. Children with migraines were also found to get less total sleep time than their healthy peers but took less time to fall asleep.

entry.title: How do migraines affect the sleep cycle?
entry.summary: Adults and children with migraines may get less quality, REM sleep time than people who don't have migraines. That's according to a meta-analysis. Children with migraines were also found to get less total sleep time than their healthy peers but took less time to fall asleep.

entry.title: Researchers provide a framework to study precision nutrigeroscience
entry.summary: There are many forms of dietary restriction and their health benefits are not 'one size fits all.' Researchers provide a framework for a new personalized sub-specialty: precision nutrigeroscience, based on biomarkers affected by genetics, gender, tissue, and age.

entry.title: Researchers provide a framework to study precision nutrigeroscience
entry.summary: There are many forms of dietary restriction and their health benefits are not 'one size fits all.' Researchers provide a framework for a new personalized sub-specialty: precision nutrigeroscience, based on biomarkers affected by genetics, gender, tissue, and age.

entry.title: Strength training can burn fat too, myth-busting study finds
entry.summary: A new systematic review and meta-analysis shows we can lose around 1.4 per cent of our entire body fat through strength training alone, which is similar to how much we might lose through cardio or aerobics.

entry.title: Azure Functions runtime 4.0 is now in public preview
entry.summary: Azure Functions 4.0 includes support for .NET 6.

entry.title: Public preview: Distributed tracing for Java apps on Azure Functions Linux
entry.summary: Distributed tracing for Java apps on Azure Functions can now be enabled through Azure portal. This integration provides additional insights into end-to-end transactions that were not previously supported, completes the application map, which aggregates many transactions to show a topological view your system, and lets you detect and diagnose performance bottlenecks.

entry.title: Intermittent fasting can help manage metabolic disease
entry.summary: Eating your daily calories within a consistent window of 8-10 hours is a powerful strategy to prevent and manage chronic diseases such as diabetes and heart disease, according to a new article.

entry.title: CodeQL code scanning now supports Java 16 language features
entry.summary: CodeQL code scanning now supports Java 16 language features

entry.title: GitHub dark high contrast theme for VS Code
entry.summary: GitHub dark high contrast theme for VS Code

entry.title: MIND diet linked to better cognitive performance
entry.summary: Researchers have found that older adults may benefit from a specific diet called the MIND diet even when they develop these protein deposits, known as amyloid plaques and tangles.

entry.title: MIND diet linked to better cognitive performance
entry.summary: Researchers have found that older adults may benefit from a specific diet called the MIND diet even when they develop these protein deposits, known as amyloid plaques and tangles.

entry.title: Which types of brain activity support conscious experiences?
entry.summary: Our subjective experience appears to us in a continuous stream of integrated information, and researchers now explore the question: Which characteristics should brain activity have to support this type of conscious experiences? The group searched for integrated structures that encompass most of the brain but change configuration from time to time. Their hypothesis was these structures should vanish during states of deep unconsciousness, such as deep sleep or while under general anesthetics.

entry.title: Is your child a fussy eater?
entry.summary: New research is providing a better understanding of what influences fussy eaters, and what is more likely to increase or decrease picky eating in children under 10.

entry.title: Sticking to low-fat dairy may not be the only heart healthy option, study shows
entry.summary: New research amongst the world's biggest consumers of dairy foods has shown that those with higher intakes of dairy fat - measured by levels of fatty acids in the blood - had a lower risk of cardiovascular disease compared to those with low intakes. Higher intakes of dairy fat were not associated with an increased risk of death.

entry.title: Eating less fat may save your hair
entry.summary: Researchers have uncovered a molecular mechanism behind why obesity can lead to hair thinning. They found that stem cells within hair follicles in mice given a high-fat diet behaved differently from those in mice with a standard diet. Inflammatory signals in the stem cells led to these differences, ultimately resulting in hair thinning and loss. These fascinating data shed light on the complicated link between obesity and organ dysfunction.

entry.title: Tab size rendering preference
entry.summary: Tab size rendering preference

entry.title: CodeQL runner deprecation
entry.summary: CodeQL runner deprecation

entry.title: Novel assay finds new mechanism underlying red blood cell aging
entry.summary: A multifaceted microfluidic in vitro assay is helping to identify the role of hypoxia on red blood cell aging via the biomechanical pathways. It holds promise for investigating hypoxic effects on the metastatic potential and relevant drug resistance of cancer cells. It also can be a useful tool to predict the mechanical performance of natural and artificial red blood cells for transfusion purposes and to further extend to red blood cells in other blood diseases and other cell types.

entry.title: Japanese Knotweed extract could cut cancer risk of processed meat
entry.summary: Scientists have developed processed red meat that includes added natural substitutes which reduces the carcinogenic compound nitrite added to preserve meats. The range of sausages and hams had a mixture of plants and fruits added to them which included rosemary, green tea, and resveratrol -- an extract taken from Japanese Knotweed.

entry.title: Pioneering EEG test could dramatically increase early diagnosis of Alzheimer’s
entry.summary: Researchers have developed a two-minute passive-test, 'Fastball EEG', that measures people's brain waves in response to a series of images and could help expand early dementia diagnosis.

entry.title: Quickly copy the contents of a file to the clipboard
entry.summary: Quickly copy the contents of a file to the clipboard

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Ephemeral self-hosted runners & new webhooks for auto-scaling
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Ephemeral self-hosted runners & new webhooks for auto-scaling

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Experience refresh for the management of self-hosted runners
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Experience refresh for the management of self-hosted runners

entry.title: Meeting sleep recommendations could lead to smarter snacking
entry.summary: Missing out on the recommended seven or more hours of sleep per night could lead to more opportunities to make poorer snacking choices than those made by people who meet shut-eye guidelines, a new study suggests.

entry.title: Meeting sleep recommendations could lead to smarter snacking
entry.summary: Missing out on the recommended seven or more hours of sleep per night could lead to more opportunities to make poorer snacking choices than those made by people who meet shut-eye guidelines, a new study suggests.

entry.title: Meeting sleep recommendations could lead to smarter snacking
entry.summary: Missing out on the recommended seven or more hours of sleep per night could lead to more opportunities to make poorer snacking choices than those made by people who meet shut-eye guidelines, a new study suggests.

entry.title: Researchers call for a focus on fitness over weight loss for obesity-related health conditions
entry.summary: The prevalence of obesity around the world has tripled over the past 40 years, and, along with that rise, dieting and attempts to lose weight also have soared. But according to a new article, when it comes to getting healthy and reducing mortality risk, increasing physical activity and improving fitness appear to be superior to weight loss. The authors say that employing a weight-neutral approach to the treatment of obesity-related health conditions also reduces the health risks associated with yo-yo dieting.

entry.title: Meds, surgery may help obesity-related high blood pressure if diet, exercise fall short
entry.summary: Being overweight or having obesity, weight that is higher than what is considered healthy for an individual's height, is a major risk factor for high blood pressure. A healthy diet, more physical activity and less sedentary time are recommended to reduce blood pressure for people who are overweight or have obesity; however, evidence of long-term weight loss and sustained blood pressure reductions from these lifestyle changes is limited. New weight-loss medications and bariatric surgery have shown benefits in both long-term weight loss and improved blood pressure, which can reduce the long-term, negative impact of high blood pressure on organ damage.

entry.title: Meds, surgery may help obesity-related high blood pressure if diet, exercise fall short
entry.summary: Being overweight or having obesity, weight that is higher than what is considered healthy for an individual's height, is a major risk factor for high blood pressure. A healthy diet, more physical activity and less sedentary time are recommended to reduce blood pressure for people who are overweight or have obesity; however, evidence of long-term weight loss and sustained blood pressure reductions from these lifestyle changes is limited. New weight-loss medications and bariatric surgery have shown benefits in both long-term weight loss and improved blood pressure, which can reduce the long-term, negative impact of high blood pressure on organ damage.

entry.title: Time until dementia symptoms appear can be estimated via brain scan
entry.summary: Researchers have developed an approach to estimating when a person who is at high risk of Alzheimer's dementia but has no cognitive symptoms will start showing signs of cognitive decline. The approach is based on data from a single brain scan, combined with the person's age.

entry.title: Secret scanning: user-defined patterns now support editing
entry.summary: Secret scanning: user-defined patterns now support editing

entry.title: 'Blue food revolution' to tackle climate change and malnutrition
entry.summary: An unprecedented review of the aquatic foods sector has uncovered how fisheries and aquaculture can play a greater role in delivering healthy diets and more sustainable, equitable and resilient food systems around the world.

entry.title: Studies biased toward genomes of people with European ancestry still predict cancer risk in diverse groups, research finds
entry.summary: Data sets that are biased by having too many genomes from people with European ancestry can still be applied to other ancestry groups to predict their risk of developing breast and prostate cancer, researchers report.

entry.title: Audit log streaming public beta
entry.summary: Audit log streaming public beta

entry.title: Parental alienation, partner abuse: Two sides of same coin, says social psychologist
entry.summary: According to a new study, parental alienating behaviors and coercively controlling abuse are similar, and should be treated similarly in family court proceedings.

entry.title: Staying young, from the cells on up
entry.summary: Researchers have discovered a new multi-enzyme complex that reprograms metabolism and overcomes 'cellular senescence,' when aging cells stop dividing.

entry.title: Early lower respiratory tract infections and obstructive sleep apnea in children
entry.summary: Researchers have identified an association between early lower respiratory tract infections and the development of obstructive sleep apnea in children.

entry.title: Pilot study of diet/exercise in young adults with intellectual disabilities is promising
entry.summary: A pilot study found that young adults with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and intellectual disabilities (ID) were able to lose or maintain their weight with a system of education and support in place.

entry.title: Pilot study of diet/exercise in young adults with intellectual disabilities is promising
entry.summary: A pilot study found that young adults with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and intellectual disabilities (ID) were able to lose or maintain their weight with a system of education and support in place.

entry.title: Likely cause of Alzheimer’s disease identified
entry.summary: Ground-breaking new research has discovered a likely cause of Alzheimer's disease, in a significant finding that offers potential new prevention and treatment opportunities.

entry.title: Contributed Systems is now a GitHub secret scanning partner
entry.summary: Contributed Systems is now a GitHub secret scanning partner

entry.title: Public preview of v4 Cosmos DB extensions for Azure Functions
entry.summary: A new major version of the Cosmos DB extensions for Azure Functions is now available in public preview.

entry.title: GitHub Education releases a new student portal
entry.summary: GitHub Education releases a new student portal

entry.title: New findings on ambient UVB radiation, vitamin D, and protection against severe COVID-19
entry.summary: New research has examined the association between vitamin D and COVID-19, and found that ambient ultraviolet B (UVB) radiation (which is key for vitamin D production in the skin) at an individual's place of residence in the weeks before COVID-19 infection, was strongly protective against severe disease and death.

entry.title: Changes to workplace cafeteria menus nudge workers to consume fewer calories
entry.summary: A study carried out at 19 workplace cafeterias has shown that reducing portion sizes and replacing higher calorie food and drinks with lower calorie options led to workers buying food and drink with fewer calories. Researchers say that even simple interventions such as these could contribute towards tackling levels of obesity.

entry.title: Study shows protein that reverses aging of skeletal muscle
entry.summary: A research team has shown that a protein named for the mythical land of youth in Irish folklore is effective at reversing aging in skeletal muscle cells.

entry.title: READMEs for organization profiles
entry.summary: READMEs for organization profiles

entry.title: Protein from the liver may cause Alzheimer's disease in the brain, study finds
entry.summary: Amyloid protein made in the liver can cause neurodegeneration in the brain, according to a new study. Since the protein is thought to be a key contributor to development of Alzheimer's disease (AD), the results suggest that the liver may play an important role in the onset or progression of the disease.

entry.title: Releases now have an Avatar List!
entry.summary: Releases now have an Avatar List!

entry.title: Gut microbiota influences the ability to lose weight
entry.summary: Gut microbiota influences the ability to lose weight in humans, according to new research.

entry.title: Gut microbiota influences the ability to lose weight
entry.summary: Gut microbiota influences the ability to lose weight in humans, according to new research.

entry.title: Notification emails for discussions
entry.summary: Notification emails for discussions

entry.title: Cholesterol drives Alzheimer’s plaque formation
entry.summary: The new findings offer important insights into how and why the plaques form and may explain why genes associated with cholesterol have been linked to increased risk for Alzheimer's.

entry.title: Body clock off-schedule? Prebiotics may help
entry.summary: A new study suggests simple dietary compounds known as prebiotics, which serve as food for beneficial gut bacteria, could play an important role in helping us bounce back faster from jet lag, shift work or other sources of circadian rhythm disruption.

entry.title: Scientists claim that overeating is not the primary cause of obesity
entry.summary: A perspective article challenges the 'energy balance model,' which says weight gain occurs because individuals consume more energy than they expend. According to the authors, 'conceptualizing obesity as a disorder of energy balance restates a principle of physics without considering the biological mechanisms underlying weight gain.' The authors argue for the 'carbohydrate insulin model,' which explains obesity as a metabolic disorder driven by what we eat, rather than how much. *Public health messaging exhorting people to eat less and exercise more has failed to stem rising rates of obesity and obesity-related diseases. *The energy balance model, which says weight gain is caused by consuming more energy than we expend, "restates a principle of physics without considering the biological mechanisms driving weight gain." *The carbohydrate-insulin model makes a bold claim: overeating doesn't cause obesity; the process of getting fat causes overeating. *The current obesity epidemic is due, in part, to hormonal responses to changes in food quality: in particular, high-glycemic load foods, which fundamentally change metabolism. *Focusing on what we eat rather than how much we eat is a better strategy for weight management.

entry.title: Men may sleep worse on nights during the first half of the lunar cycle
entry.summary: Men's sleep may be more powerfully influenced by the lunar cycle than women's, according to a new study.
